alert.note: Alert for Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Essex; Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 9:28PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Isolated strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Middlesex, Northumberland, southeastern Hanover, northern Sussex, southeastern Dinwiddie, northwestern James City, northwestern Gloucester, King and Queen, Charles City, Prince George, Richmond, New Kent, southern Westmoreland, southeastern Henrico, King William, northwestern Surry, Essex and Lancaster Counties, the City of Colonial Heights, the City of Hopewell and the City of Petersburg through 1030 PM EST... At 927 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking showers and isolated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Loretto to near Talleysville to 6 miles west of Stony Creek. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts to 40 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... New Kent, Talleysville, Newland, Loretto and Tunstall around 935 PM EST. King William around 940 PM EST. West Point, Disputanta, King And Queen Court House and Stevensville around 945 PM EST. Prince George and Little Plymouth around 950 PM EST. Jamaica, Church View, Garysville and Center Cross around 955 PM EST. Burrowsville, Cabin Point and Sharps around 1000 PM EST. Charles City, Claremont, Robley, Morattico and Farnham around 1005 PM EST. Lancaster, Rustic and Holdcroft around 1010 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Eltham, Threeway, Croaker, Wayside, Brook Vale, Belle Isle State Park, Glendale, Rose Garden, Lyells and Richard Bland College. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
